channel.title: Microsoft 365 Platform Community Blog
channel.description: Recent content on Microsoft 365 Platform Community Blog

item.title: CLI for Microsoft 365 - how cool is that? - Tips and tricks
item.description: CLI for Microsoft 365 is a cross platform command line tool based on Node.js that helps you manage many things around Microsoft 365 and your SPFx project (yes, that as well ü§©. rename, upgrade … you name it). You may manage OneDrive, Planner, Power Apps and Automate, Teams, Yammer, SharePoint (of course). The list keeps on growing and growing. Lets check some tips and tricks which may improve your experience with CLI for Microsoft 365.

CLI for Microsoft 365 is a cross platform command line tool based on Node.js that helps you manage many things around Microsoft 365 and your SPFx project (yes, that as well ü§©. rename, upgrade ‚Ä¶ you name it). You may manage OneDrive, Planner, Power Apps and Automate, Teams, Yammer, SharePoint (of course). The list keeps on growing and growing. Lets check some tips and tricks which may improve your experience with CLI for Microsoft 365.
item.dc:creator: Adam W√≥jcik

item.title: Run Azure DevOps Pipelines by uninvited users to projects from Power Platform
item.description: Run Azure DevOps Pipelines by uninvited users to projects from Power Platform We will make use of Premium connectors (Azure DevOps, when a HTTP request is received, HTTP) and the standard Excel for Business and Microsoft Team connectors.

Run Azure DevOps Pipelines by uninvited users to projects from Power Platform We will make use of Premium connectors (Azure DevOps, when a HTTP request is received, HTTP) and the standard Excel for Business and Microsoft Team connectors.

item.title: CLI for Microsoft 365 v5.6
item.description: We’ve just published a new major version of the CLI for Microsoft 365 with new commands for working with and managing Microsoft 365 and SharePoint Framework projects on any platform.

item.title: How to Display Data from Multiple SharePoint Lists using PnPjs and DataTables
item.description: In this article, we will learn how to use PnPjs to get data from multiple SharePoint lists and display the collected data in a jQuery Datatables in SharePoint 2013/2016/2019 or online without a SPFx webpart.

In this article, we will learn how to use PnPjs to get data from multiple SharePoint lists and display the collected data in a jQuery Datatables in SharePoint 2013/2016/2019 or online without a SPFx webpart.
item.dc:creator: Arash Aghajani

item.title: Microsoft 365 & Power Platform Development Community call - 4th of August, 2022
item.description: Demos: ProvisionGenie v.3.0 ‚Äì focus on Localization and Accessability and List formatting backgrounds and borders using new isSelected placeholder. Delivered 8 new/updated Power Platform Independent Publisher Connectors along with 5 script, and 2 Power Platform samples.

item.title: Delete all redirect sites after tenant rename
item.description: It is possible to change the SharePoint domain name after an organisation has gone through a rebranding, acquisition or needs to change to a more appropriate name¬†Change your SharePoint domain name (preview).

item.title: Microsoft Identity Platform community call ‚Äì July 2022
item.description: Integrate a React single-page app with the Microsoft identity platform. Enable SSO and get an access token for Microsoft Graph API. Subscribe to MSAL events, protect routes using MSAL Angular Guard, and acquire tokens with MSAL React hooks.

Integrate a React single-page app with the Microsoft identity platform. Enable SSO and get an access token for Microsoft Graph API. Subscribe to MSAL events, protect routes using MSAL Angular Guard, and acquire tokens with MSAL React hooks.

item.description: Demos: Document automation using Microsoft SharePoint Syntex Content Assembly, Building a conversational tab in a Microsoft Teams app that captures external event conversations, and List formatting tips. item.title: Adaptive Cards community call ‚Äì July 2022
item.description: Action.ToggleVisibility Deprecation (a non-breaking change for a control that needs to support accessibility requirements for all users), Adaptive Cards Handle Responses Connector now GA, React Native Adaptive Cards Renderer next month and 10-minute Q&A.

item.title: Power Query ETL Capabilities
item.description: Garbage in, garbage out. This phrase conveys that incorrect or poor data quality will produce faulty and bad output.

item.title: M365 Development Security - From full trust to ZeroTrust
item.description: This article will showcase typical SharePoint and Microsoft 365 development security patterns. Those patterns can be applied especially in so-called ZeroTrust environments, too, and are linked to step-by-step implementation guidances.

This article will showcase typical SharePoint and Microsoft 365 development security patterns. Those patterns can be applied especially in so-called ZeroTrust environments, too, and are linked to step-by-step implementation guidances.
item.dc:creator: Markus Moeller

item.description: Demos - Building Publishing Connectors for MailJet product, Microsoft Graph ‚ÄúSites.Selected‚Äù permissions within SharePoint Online, and Introduction to available open-source list formatting samples from updated list formatting sample portal. item.title: Microsoft Identity Platform community call ‚Äì June 2022
item.description: Deep dive into how your app can build on Teams SSO and the Microsoft identity platform. We will also discuss how you can connect the Microsoft Identity of a user to your own user store.

item.title: How to build a color-contrast-ratio checker for improved accessibility in Power Apps
item.description: tl:dr Color contrast ratio is important for accessibility - here is how to build an in-app checker to build more accessible Power Apps
